        public void returnTokenPositions()
        Switches to the mode in which token positions (instead of character positions) are returned in the output structures.

      • returnCharacterPositions

        public void returnCharacterPositions()
        Switches to the mode in which character positions (instead of token positions) are returned in the output structures.

      • producesTokenPositions

        public boolean producesTokenPositions()
        For checking the type of returned start/end position information.
        Returns:
        true if the gazetteer returns token positions, or false otherwise.

      • caseInsensitiveModeActive

        public void caseInsensitiveModeActive()
        Switches to the case-insensitive mode, i.e., the input text is downcased before processing, but not the gazetteer entries.

      • caseSensitiveModeActive

        public void caseSensitiveModeActive()
        Switches to the case-sensitive mode.

        For checking if the case-sensitive mode is on
        Returns:

      • findMatch

        public java.util.ArrayList<AbstractDisjunctionOfGazetteerItems> findMatch(java.util.ArrayList<AbstractTokenItem> tokens,
                                                                          java.lang.String inputText)
        Applies the gazetteer to a given input text, and returns an array list of disjunctions of gazetteer items, where each such disjunction represents a match (possibly with more than one reading) in the input text at a given position. By default start/end token positions are returned, and the gazetteer works in the case-sensitive modus.
        Parameters:
        tokens - an array list of tokens (See also AbstractTokenItem )
        inputText - string representing the input text
        Returns:
        an array list of disjunctions of gazetteer items.

      • findMatch

        public abstract java.util.ArrayList<AbstractDisjunctionOfGazetteerItems> findMatch(java.util.ArrayList<AbstractTokenItem> tokens,
                                                                                   char[] inputText)
        Applies the gazetteer to a given input text, and returns an array list of disjunctions of gazetteer items, where each such disjunction represents a match (possibly with more than one reading) in the input text at a given position. By default start/end token positions are returned, and the gazetteer works in the case-sensitive modus.
        Parameters:
        tokens - an array list of tokens (See also AbstractTokenItem )
        inputText - character array with the input text
        Returns:
        an array list of disjunctions of gazetteer items.

      • lookUp

        public abstract AbstractDisjunctionOfGazetteerItems lookUp(char[] word)
        Looks up for an entry in the gazetteer for a given string.
        Parameters:
        word - input string
        Returns:
        disjunction of gazetteer entries for the given input string or null if no entries were found.

      • lookUpLongestPrefix

        public abstract AbstractDisjunctionOfGazetteerItems lookUpLongestPrefix(char[] word)
        Looks for a longest prefix in a given string for which there is a match in the gazetteer.
        Parameters:
        word - input string
        Returns:
        disjunction of gazetteer entries for identified longest prefix or null if no such prefix could be found.

      • lookUp

        public AbstractDisjunctionOfGazetteerItems lookUp(java.lang.String word)
        Looks up for an entry in the gazetteer for a given string.
        Parameters:
        word - input string (as String)
        Returns:
        disjunction of gazetteer entries for the given input string or null if no entries were found.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • createInstance

        public static AbstractGazetteer createInstance(java.lang.String type)
        Factory method for obtaining gazetteer instances (Currently one implementation is available)
        Parameters:
        type - string which specifies which implementation of gazetteer is chosen.

        Following types are avaialable:

        • basicGazeetteer

        Returns:
        a handle to a dynamically created gazetteer

      • createFrom

        public abstract boolean createFrom(java.lang.String[] attributes,
                                   java.lang.String[] entryList,
                                   Configuration configuration)
                            throws GazetteerException
        Creates a gazetteer for a given list of entries/attributes and compilation configuration
        Parameters:
        attributes - object representing the attributes
        entryList - list of the entries
        configuration - compilation configuration
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successfull, or false otherwise.
        Throws:
        GazetteerException - in case the operation can not be carried out appropriately

      • findMatchAtGivenPosition

        public abstract AbstractDisjunctionOfGazetteerItems findMatchAtGivenPosition(java.util.ArrayList<AbstractTokenItem> tokens,
                                                                             char[] inputText,
                                                                             int startPos,
                                                                             boolean enforceWhitespaceAfter)
        Find matches at a given position in the given text.
        Parameters:
        tokens - an array list of tokens (See also AbstractTokenItem )
        inputText - character array representing the input text
        startPos - start token position
        enforceWhitespaceAfter - specifies whether a match must be followed by a whitespace
        Returns:
        a disjunction of gazetteer items

        startPos - start token position
